title: Font Recognize
content:
Hi guys, I saw this beautiful movie (Juliet of the Spirits) and I was surprised by the beauty of this weird, vernacular font. I tried to recognize its without good results. Hope you guys could give me some help on that.  
Thanks in advance

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132624im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Schermata%202014-02-28%20alle%2010_4696.31.57.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132624im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Schermata%202014-02-28%20alle%2010_5885.31.50.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132624im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Schermata%202014-02-28%20alle%2010_3424.34.12.png)
author: Gian_LO_FI

comments.content: I am afraid it looks handwritten. Literally every letter is slightely different. Compare the a’s, e’s and so on carefully.
Probably not handwritten, but it can be manually modified starting from a sans-serif. What you think? I mean all the beginning and ending title are using it.

If you post your request in the font ID forum [http://typophile.com/typeid](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132624/http:/typophile.com/typeid "http://typophile.com/typeid") I expect one of the font detectives will suggest a good substitute.  
don
